level.ecm_name: Passive FaÃ§ade External Thermal Insulation Composite System - EPS 250mm
level.description: ETICS consists of certain prefabricated components that can be applied onsite, directly to the faÃ§ade. With more valuable material degradation can be avoid degradation and a higher thermal and resistance capacity, but the prices of this material will make the system less economic.

level.application: Where external walls are poorly insulated.- Where external walls are deteriorating or are insufficiently weather-tight, causing damp, draughts and heat loss.- Where it is intended to change the image of the building- Where the building is not in a conservation area.
level.advantages: - Energy saving: It reduces the amount of energy needed for heating. Near 50%. - Improved comfort: Reduces rapid heat loss and cycles of heating and cooling.- Condensation reduction: It reduces the naturally occurring levels of humidity.- Aesthetic appeal: It has an important role in improving the external image.- Weather proofing: It overcomes difficult or complex problems of water.- Insulation performance: Thermal conductivity of 0.039 and 0.043 W/mÂ·K..- Impact resistance: Impact resistant plaster baseboard and 8-10-mm.- Versatility: There are many different sizes.- Economy: It is really economic when comparing to Ventilated FaÃ§ade.- Acoustic insulation: Soundproofing with reduction up to 54 dB.
level.disadvantages: Non-load-bearing: They do not contribute directly to the stability of the wall.Airtightness: ETICS are not intended to ensure the airtightness of the building.Not applied in protected areas: Because of the change of faÃ§ade and image.
level.links_to_barriers: Maximum value faÃ§ades can grow externally
level.installation_data: The installation should be done in dry weather, with temperature not lower between +5 Â°C and +30 Â°C
level.maintenance_data: It needs periodically revisions with the technical analysis of the building
